question: According to Hobbes, Sovereign power is?
explanation: According to Hobbes's social Contract, a Sovereign came into existence whose powers were undivided, unlimited, inalienable and permanent because he was the creation of the will of the people. He held that, The Sovereign was result of the contract ,thus, not a party to the contract. Therefore, all the Individuals in Society were the Subjects of Sovereign and he has no obligation towards the subject.
